programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Superflares are amongst the greatest events of the Universe. These magnetic explosions can release energy millions of times greater than atomic bombs. They produce streams of highly energetic particles which can be highly destructive to life.
programme.sub-title: Super Flares - Could They Cause Mass Extinction?

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: By far the largest planet, 1300 times the size of Earth, it’s a world so enormous it could swallow every planet and moon in the solar system and still have room to spare.

programme.title: Naked Science

programme.sub-title: How To Avert an Asteroid Impact

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Danger, Asteroids Ahead
programme.desc: The threat of an asteroid strike is a very real danger in our solar system, mankind is now in a position to defend the planet from such an eventuality.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Atmosphere
programme.desc: Our atmosphere is an unbelievably complex machine that protects us from the vacuum of space, shelters us from harmful radiation and allows us and the biosphere to breath; we need to learn much more about it so we can better it.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Atmosphere
programme.desc: Our atmosphere is an unbelievably complex machine that protects us from the vacuum of space, shelters us from harmful radiation and allows us and the biosphere to breath; we need to learn much more about it so we can better it.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Living Planet

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Moons of Olympus
programme.desc: There are many more worlds in our solar system than just the planets. The mysterious moons of the gas giants may hold much more than we ever imagined. Each one is unique, and each one deserves a scrutinous eye.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure
programme.desc: Our non-heinous heroes Bill (Alex Winter) and Ted (Keanu Reeves) are in danger of flunking history! But when the righteous Rufus (George Carlin) arrives in a time-travelling phone booth, the dense dudes discover their destiny!

programme.title: Hollywood Homicide
programme.desc: A pair of detectives investigate a murder while pursuing their other full-time professions. Welcome to Hollywood Homicide - the only place where you can come to work hungry, horny, thirsty, and broke, and resolve all four by the end of the watch.

programme.title: Clerks II
programme.desc: A calamity at Dante and Randall's shops sends them looking for new horizons, but they ultimately settle at Mooby's, a fictional Disney-McDonald's-style fast-food empire. Sequel to the 1994 film by Kevin Smith.

programme.title: Clerks III
programme.desc: Following a massive heart attack, Randal enlists his friends and fellow clerks Dante, Elias, Jay, and Silent Bob to make a movie immortalizing his life at the convenience store that started it all.

programme.title: Mystery Team
programme.desc: They were kid detectives. Now they're 18 and still solving child crimes. But when The Mystery Team is challenged to crack a murder case, they see an opportunity to finally prove themselves as real detectives once and for all.

programme.title: Safety Not Guaranteed
programme.desc: When an unusual ad inspires three cynical Seattle magazine employees to look for the story behind it, they discover a mysterious eccentric named Kenneth, a likable but paranoid supermarket clerk, who believes he's solved the riddle of time travel.

programme.title: The To Do List
programme.desc: Valedictorian, Brandy wants to get "educated" before college, so she assembles a list of all the sexual activities she missed out on. Quickly realizing that she's way out of her league, Brandy solicits her sister and burn-out boss for their help.

programme.title: Life After Beth
programme.desc: Zach is devastated by the unexpected death of his girlfriend, Beth (Aubrey Plaza) until she miraculously comes back to life. However, the newly returned Beth isn’t quite how he remembered and before long, Zach’s whole world takes a turn for the worse.

programme.title: The Little Hours
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, a young servant fleeing from his master takes refuge at a convent full of emotionally unstable nuns. Introduced as a deaf mute man, he must fight to hold his cover as the nuns try to resist temptation.

programme.title: Uptown Girls
programme.desc: Molly Gunn is the daughter of a late rock legend, and the toast of New York City. But when her inheritance is stolen, Molly is forced to do something she's never done before - get a job. Molly becomes a nanny to a girl, who is "eight going on forty."

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: Max and Page are a mother/daughter con team. Max targets wealthy men and marries them. Page then seduces them while Max "catches" her wayward husbands in the act. Then on to the next mark, posing in a variety of guises to keep one step ahead of the law.

programme.title: A Walk to Remember

programme.title: A Little Bit of Heaven

programme.title: I Could Never Be Your Woman
programme.desc: A mother falls for a younger man while her daughter falls in love for the first time. Mother Nature messes with their fates.

programme.title: Julie & Julia

programme.desc: Simples y sofisticadas es la mejor manera de describir las recetas tradicionales españolas del chef Luis "Tigretón" León. Nos muestra por qué la trucha y el jamón son los nuevos mar y tierra.

programme.title: Comfort Food
programme.desc: ¡No hay nada como la comida criolla! En este episodio, el chef Ignacio Barrios nos enseña y nos cuenta sobre sus primeros encuentros con la cocina peruana profesional.

programme.title: Comfort Food
programme.desc: Fácil y rico, no hay mejor combinación. Recordando su infancia, el chef Ignacio nos enseña a preparar tres deliciosos platos que hacía su madre.

programme.title: Pescado desconocido
programme.desc: Finaliza la primera temporada y volveremos a ver a Kumar en Santiago de Surco. Preparará un pescado en tres platos distintivos llamado fortuno. ¿Funcionará?

programme.title: Pescado desconocido
programme.desc: Kumar está interesado en saber cuál es el sabor de la doncella, así que fuimos a Lince a buscar este pescado y verá que da como resultado tres platos que preparará. ¡Seamos parte de lo que viene a continuación, vamos!

programme.title: Rebelde sin cocina
programme.desc: FG lanzó su carrera en el mercado subterráneo de Toronto (TUM), por lo que está emocionado de participar nuevamente. Con su negocio creciendo minuto a minuto, FG debe comenzar a buscar los próximos pasos dentro de la marca.

programme.title: Rebelde sin cocina
programme.desc: Los eventos se hacen cada vez más grandes. Desde su primer pop-up en una cafetería hipster hasta un evento gastronómico independiente masivo, FG ha recorrido un largo camino. El Museo Real de Ontario (ROM) ha solicitado que FG aparezca en su evento.

programme.title: Parilla sobre ruedas
programme.desc: Matt y el equipo preparan una fiesta de verano: pierna de cordero con hierbas de verano, lomo de cerdo al romero a la parrilla con salsa de bayas silvestres, trucha a la parrilla con duraznos y ensalada de tomate.

programme.title: Parilla sobre ruedas
programme.desc: Matt y el equipo de Road Grill pasan el día jugando en el parque acuático. El pollo asado con mantequilla de lima-limón asado, los pinchos de pez espada a la parrilla con salsa caribeña y las chuletas de cerdo son las estrellas.

programme.title: Media hora y listo!
programme.desc: ¿Qué es divertido para toda la familia? ¡La noche de pizza! El chef Spencer Watts prepara dos sencillas y económicas pizzas para un delicioso plato estilo familiar.

programme.title: Media hora y listo!
programme.desc: Los platos de la India son el ejemplo ideal de las cenas para la familia entera. El presentador Spencer Watts hace uso de sabores audaces para preparar un pollo con mantequilla clásico y un refrescante lassi de mango.

programme.title: El pescado en el plátillo
programme.desc: Al pescado le encantan las especias y al chef Spencer Watts le encanta el pescado, por lo que trae el delicioso mundo de las especias al pez mantequilla y a la langosta junto con algunos lados refrescantes.

programme.title: El pescado en el plátillo
programme.desc: El chef Spencer Watts comparte algunas de sus recetas favoritas de caballa y mejillón en las que destacan las vibrantes y frescas hierbas aromáticas.

programme.title: Ponlo a la parrilla
programme.desc: En este capítulo, Christian Bravo prepara un delicioso carpaccio de solomillo fino con pesto y una picaña ahumada con una bebida Johnnie Ginger.

programme.title: Ponlo a la parrilla
programme.desc: Christian Bravo, acompañado de su amigo Jacomo, cocina deliciosas brochetas y un sándwich tri tip con un refrescante Johnnie Ginger.

programme.title: Taste Of The Country
programme.desc: Es el apogeo del otoño y las cosas se están enfriando en el granero, pero con la esperanza de calentar las cosas con las festividades, South Pond organiza un brunch para celebrar la cosecha de otoño y la comunidad local de agricultores y proveedores.

programme.title: Taste Of The Country
programme.desc: Las habilidades de Danielle para organizar fiestas de menor tamaño se ponen a prueba cuando organiza una cena íntima con música en vivo en Iron Horse Ranch.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Tour de un cocinero
programme.desc: ¿Qué tipo de barbacoa reina en la ciudad de Kansas, Houston o Carolina del Norte? Tony viaja a las tres ciudades para probar por sí mismo los secretos que esconden las salsas, los huesos de madera y los fumadores lentos.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Tour de un cocinero

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The eliminators continue as more newcomers and veterans enter the arena, ready to destroy each other for the spot in the finals. One competitor's design renders their adversary's weapon useless.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Vengeance battles ensue as robots engage in one-on-one competition to settle old scores. In the main event, world champion Razer looks to get back at Pussycat, who caused some major damage in a previous round.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: More hopefuls enter the arena, as they risk life and limb for a chance at the finals. An equally matched battle leaves the decisions to the judges, and two house robots work together to inflict some last minute damage.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Halfway through the heats and the competition is on fire, literally. The arena is out for revenge after another competitor inadvertently vandalises it. One robot commits the ultimate sin, attacking the benevolent Refbot.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Six years on and the mechanical marvels only get more sophisticated, more brutal, and show less mercy. Watch in awe as robots from all over the country battle for the right to survive another week.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: One competitor achieves every flipper robot's dream in this episode's heats, rapidly ending the first round. Another robot refuses to go into the pit alone and takes down whoever they can get grip on.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: One competitor gets chopped up by competitor and house robot alike and a quick eviction from the arena makes the judge's job a simple one. A seemingly one-sided fight takes a different direction, thanks to the hazardous arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: The final eight robots of the series compete to see who can make the next round, as they take on not just each other, but also the chaotic and destructive house robots to find out which is the very best robot.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: World Champions meet a newcomer in this episode's heat. One uneventful round leaves the house robots responsible for entertaining the crowd.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: The best robots in the country continue their quest to be crowned All Star Champion. Will `Razer' and `Chaos 2' win places in the final? It's all to play for in the competition's semi-final.

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Featuring the most deadly robots ever seen on the programme. Will the fur-brained Diotoir and Pussycat survive the chrome-plated carnage created by Steel Avenger and Suicidal Tendencies?

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme
programme.desc: Six winners of previous robot wars challenges meet to battle it out and see who is the best, as they attempt to take each other out in an extreme fight to the death.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Robot Wars: The Fifth Wars will have a champion. As the proven best robots of the series gather one last time, the competition has never been more evenly matched.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: An extensive and informative dive behind-the-scenes on the House Robots. Get inside information from designer Chris Reynolds, on what goes into creating these killing machines.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Follow Team Chaos's journey, from humble beginnings to how they ended up building one of the most feared Robots ever to compete.

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.title: Robot Wars: Extreme

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.desc: Coffee; red-eye gravy and grits; Southern smoke house; curing ham; antique toasters; fruit smoothies and granola.
programme.sub-title: Fried Eggs; The Perfect Cup of Coffee; Homemade Granola

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living

programme.title: Martha Gardens

programme.title: Martha Gardens

programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; Martha is creating a brand new rose garden with almost 200 roses; from color to fragrance, the inspired world of roses is a very good thing.

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver

programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: The House Of The Lost On The Cape [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A strange old woman allows a teenage runaway and a young orphan to stay in an abandoned house overlooking the sea. However, when a menacing entity threatens their new home, they must band together and face their fears to save it.

programme.title: Giovanni's Island [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A dramatic yet heart-warming story of cross-cultural friendship among children in the aftermath of WWII, presented by Tokyo-based award-winning animation studio Production I.G. Based on true events.

programme.title: City Hunter: .357 Magnum
programme.desc: A beautiful pianist comes to Tokyo for a charity concert, and City Hunter is there. But music isn't his forte; he wants lessons in the language of love. Desperation becomes the word of the day as the bodies start dropping.

programme.title: City Hunter: Bay City Wars
programme.desc: Beautiful American Emily O'Hara offers the City Hunter (Ryo Saeba & Kaori Makimura) one million dollars to protect her from a man named Douglas. Ryo & Kaori take the job, but things are not quite what they seem. The real target just might be Ryo.

programme.title: City Hunter: Million Dollar Conspiracy
programme.desc: A new island resort has been built in Tokyo bay, and it is run by one of the world's most powerful supercomputers. The City Hunter gang has been invited to the grand opening party, but only Miki & Kaori have gotten there.

programme.title: Millennium Actress [Japanese-Language Version]
programme.desc: When the legendary Ginei Studios shuts down, filmmaker Genya Tachibana and his assistant are tasked with interviewing its reclusive star, Chiyoko Fujiwara, who had retired from the spotlight 30 years prior.

programme.title: Ghost In The Shell
programme.desc: 2029 – A female government cyber agent and the Internal Bureau of Investigations are hot on the trail of a "The Puppet Master" – a computer virus capable of invading cybernetic brains and altering its victim’s memory.

programme.title: Bleach: Memories of Nobody
programme.desc: Ichigo and his fellow Soul Reapers must save two worlds from annihilation.

programme.title: Bleach: The DiamondDust Rebellion
programme.desc: After the treasured Ouin is stolen, Toshiro Hitsugaya disappears and becomes suspected of treason.

programme.title: Sailor Moon R: The Movie
programme.desc: Sailor Moon and the Sailor Guardians unite to save Earth from an alien force!

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as Noah in the timeless story of courage, sacrifice, and hope. This visually stunning, action-adventure is hailed as "one of the most unforgettable Biblical epics ever put on film." *Richard Roeper, Chicago-Sun-Times

programme.title: A Kid in King Arthur's Court
programme.desc: When a violent earthquake rocks Southern California, hapless teenager Calvin Fuller (Thomas Ian Nicholas) finds himself careening through a hole torn in the fabric of time.

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: A man discovers that he possesses the ability to instantly teleport anywhere in the world.

programme.title: Stolen
programme.desc: A former thief frantically searches for his missing daughter, who has been kidnapped and locked in the trunk of a taxi. Starring Nicolas Cage and Malin Akerman.

programme.title: Once Upon A Time In America
programme.desc: Sergio Leone's final film is the epic tale of the life of a Jewish gangster in New York.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: An edge-of-your-seat espionage thriller, starring Richard Gere and Topher Grace as ex-CIA and FBI agents, trying to find the killer of a US senator, which bears the hallmark of an infamous Soviet assassin, thought to be dead.

programme.title: To the Ends of Time
programme.desc: In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time itself for the love of his princess and the future of his land.

programme.title: Scales
programme.desc: Mermaids are real! Siren has lived her whole life thinking she's an ordinary girl, but on the eve of her 12th birthday she learns that she is destined to become a mermaid. She must say goodbye to her entire life as she transitions into the water.

programme.title: Windstorm
programme.desc: Rebel teen Mika encounters a beautiful, wild stallion named Windstorm at her grandmother's riding school and learns she can communicate with horses.

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: A raven-haired enchantress, Cassie Nightingale, mysteriously moves into the local haunted mansion, 'Grey House', and seems to change her neighbors lives using a hint of magic causing many to think she’s a witch.

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: The Simple Life of Noah Dearborn
programme.desc: Academy Award winners Sidney Poitier and Dianne Wiest star with Mary-Louise Parker in this enchanting tale about a quiet hero who becomes the talk of the town.

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: Experience the magical world of 'The Secret Garden' as never before in this beautiful production of the classic tale. When her parents are lost in a tragic accident, Mary must seek comfort in the strange and forgotten corridors of Misselthwaite Factory.

programme.title: Storm Boy
programme.desc: When Michael Kingley, a successful retired businessman starts to see images from his past that he can't explain, he's forced to remember his childhood and how, as a boy, he rescued and raised an extraordinary orphaned pelican, Mr Percival.

programme.title: The Chaperone
programme.desc: Ray’s been asked to chaperone a school trip with his daughter Sally’s class. When characters from Ray’s criminal past believe he stole the loot from a bank they robbed, Ray will do whatever it takes to keep his daughter and her class out of harms way.

programme.title: Benji
programme.desc: Two school kids strike up a friendship with an orphaned puppy named Benji. When danger befalls them and they end up kidnapped by robbers who are in over their heads, Benji and his scruffy sidekick come to the rescue.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Weekend Warriors
programme.desc: Tuna.com continues its winning streak, catching two fish in one day while the rest of the fleet struggles to even find a spot to fish in between the weekend recreational boaters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Size Matters
programme.desc: Meet Kevin and the Christina, a boat that gets its own real-life fish story when it snags an 1,100-pound \\"monstah\\" right out of the gate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Greed, Ego & Jealousy
programme.desc: After watching the Christina catch the biggest tuna of the season, the uber-competitive Captain Dave of the Tuna.com is obsessed with beating the record, and catching a fish bigger than 1,075 lbs!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mann gegen Sturm
programme.desc: Marciano, captain of Hard Merchandise, risks the elements to hook a giant bluefin and finds himself with boat trouble in the midst of the storm.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mutiny at Sea
programme.desc: A mixture of bad luck and mutiny brews in this tumultuous episode of Wicked Tuna. Tensions erupt on New England's top tuna boat, Tuna.Com, when Captain Dave and Paul get into a heated confrontation that causes Paul to quit!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Grudge Match
programme.desc: With just two weeks left until the end of tuna fishing season, Bounty Hunter gains a new deckhand.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Ralph in Not
programme.desc: A hard season with little money to show has taken its toll on the crew of the Odysea, leading Captain Ralph to lash out at his first mate Pirate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Good to the Last Bite
programme.desc: As the final week of tuna fishing begins, the Hard Merchandise, the Bounty Hunter, the Tuna.Com and the Odysea steam out together, each captain vowing to catch the biggest tuna before the season ends.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Back In The Hunt
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, head for open seas in hopes of catching the first fish of the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Go Fish!
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for the elusive and lucrative giant Bluefin tuna, with harpooners going up against rod-and-reelers.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Numbers War
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester battle for prime fishing spots in their quest to catch the elusive and lucrative Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Fish Fight
programme.desc: For the tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, it's tournament time, and, with a big cash prize up for grabs, the fight is on to catch the biggest bluefin.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Shark Attack
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, are facing a dangerous new foe, with great white sharks swarming into local waters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sweet Smell of Revenge
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle droves of bumbling amateur fishermen in their bid to catch lucrative Atlantic Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Storm Warning
programme.desc: A storm is racing towards the north Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the captains have no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Hell On The High Seas
programme.desc: It is week eight of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, and cracks are starting to show in the Gloucester fleet, with captains and crews pushing each other to the limit.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Meltdown
programme.desc: Tensions reach their breaking point amongst the Gloucester fleet as captains, mates and vessels fall apart.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Carnage
programme.desc: It's a battle of wills on the North Atlantic, as two of Gloucester's top Bluefin fishermen - friends-turned-foes Paul Hebert and Dave Carraro - go head-to-head to out-fish each other.

programme.title: Connect the World
programme.desc: Presenting a journey across the continents to explore all the varied landscapes and cultures. Thus, making this world more connected.

programme.title: One World With Zain Asher and Bianna Golodryga
programme.desc: A fresh and inclusive take on the top stories from Africa, Europe and beyond, giving every continent an equal voice.

programme.title: Amanpour
programme.desc: Join Christiane Amanpour as she provides her powerful interview skills and provocative analysis on global stories that matter to you.

programme.title: Isa Soares Tonight
programme.desc: Isa Soares breaks down the news of the day, curating the stories that matter as well as getting into exactly why they are important to discuss.

programme.title: What We Know With Max Foster
programme.desc: Max Foster brings a definitive round-up of the day's top stories, giving you the urgent need-to-know context and diving deeper into the questions sparking debate around the world.

programme.title: Quest Means Business
programme.desc: Richard Quest presents a round-up of the day's global business news with a focus on international business and market trends.

programme.title: The Lead With Jake Tapper
programme.desc: Covering all the day's top stories around the country and the globe, from politics to money, sports to popular culture.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: Highlights and action from the world's sporting competitions.

programme.title: The Brief with Jim Sciutto
programme.desc: The best of CNN's reporting from correspondents across the world, to guide global audiences through the fast-paced news cycle with insight, analysis and hard-hitting interviews.

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: Anchor Erin Burnett presents information beyond the regular headlines by providing objective reports on top issues along with compelling interviews, lively debates and in-depth analysis of situations.

programme.title: Anderson Cooper 360
programme.desc: Anderson Cooper brings his prickly but often witty perspective to current events and personalities in the news. He is joined by a series of guests that frequently include political and legal analysts.

programme.title: The Source With Kaitlan Collins
programme.desc: President Trump is back in Washington. He secures a big win in his long time quest to get allies to spend more on their defence. He also faced multiple questions about an intelligence report questioning the impact of the US strikes on Iran.

programme.title: CNN NewsNight With Abby Phillip
programme.desc: Abby Phillip delivers a smart, sharp approach to the day's biggest stories.

programme.title: Laura Coates Live
programme.desc: Laura Coates discusses the daily intersections of politics, pop culture and the law.

programme.title: CNN Newsroom
programme.desc: A rotating cast of anchors and contributors present daily headlines and breaking stories live from CNN headquarters in Atlanta.

programme.title: Woman Walks Ahead

programme.desc: When a social media scandal threatens entrepreneur Ethan Cox's company acquisition, he hires 71-year-old snack cart vendor, Dotty, as a figurehead. But when Dotty embraces her role and refuses to be a puppet, Ethan's plans are challenged.

programme.title: Playing It Cool
programme.desc: A screenwriter (Chris Evans) working on a script for a romantic movie, is having a hard time as he ruins every relationship he has. He then meets a girl (Michelle Monaghan) who captures his heart ? only to find out she's already engaged.

programme.title: The Little Hours
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, a young servant fleeing from his master takes refuge at a convent full of emotionally unstable nuns. Introduced as a deaf mute man, he must fight to hold his cover as the nuns try to resist temptation.

programme.title: The Little Hours

programme.title: The Love Club: Nicole
programme.desc: Freshly engaged interior designer, Nicole, still wonders if the one she is meant to be with is her mystery college pen pal whose letters she has kept all these years.

programme.title: Hint of Love
programme.desc: A cookbook literary agent with culinary training is tasked with helping elevate the brand of a food channel personality known for his convenience-oriented recipes.

programme.title: For Love And Honour CA
programme.desc: A by-the-book veteran takes over at a failing military academy and immediately clashes with the beautiful dean of academics. Eventually, sparks fly as they're forced to become close to save their school.

programme.title: Planning on Forever
programme.desc: Emma, an events planner with no time for love, agrees to plan her sister's wedding in just six weeks with the help of Liam, whom Emma had a disastrous blind date with years ago.

programme.title: A Picture of Her
programme.desc: Beth unwittingly becomes the subject of an award-winning magazine’s cover and goes on a quest to uncover the true identity of the mystery photographer who snapped her photo.

programme.title: The Wedding Veil Journey
programme.desc: Tracy and Nick agree to set aside work to make time for a long overdue honeymoon to Greece. When they are stranded on a secluded island, they confront their life choices.

programme.title: Journey of My Heart
programme.desc: A young wildlife biologist travels to a remote Alaskan nesting area of bald eagles where she receives inspirational guidance from a Native American family and help from a mysterious wilderness guide.

programme.title: The Vows we Keep
programme.desc: An event planner must organize the perfect wedding for her sister in less than a month when she finds out the Rosewood, a historic inn and beloved wedding venue, is being sold.

programme.title: Fly Away With Me
programme.desc: When Angie moves into her 'no pets allowed' building, a parrot arrives unexpectedly. New neighbor Ted and the dog he's secretly sitting try to help her find the bird's owner without being caught.

programme.title: Yes, I Do
programme.desc: Busy chocolatier Charlotte has left helicopter mechanic James at the altar two times, and now she needs to prove to him that she really does want to marry him.

programme.title: Finding Father Christmas
programme.desc: Christmas for Miranda is a painful reminder of the family she never had. Her mother died when she was young, never revealing the identity of her father. But, three days before Christmas, she unexpectedly receives a clue.

programme.title: Christmas Scavenger Hunt
programme.desc: When Belinda heads back to her hometown for the holidays, things get complicated when she is forced to team up with her ex, Dustin, at the town's annual Christmas scavenger hunt.

programme.title: A Dickens of a Holiday!
programme.desc: To make the 100th anniversary of her hometown’s Victorian festival a success, Cassie invites action movie star and former high school classmate Jake to play Scrooge in 'A Christmas Carol'.

programme.title: A Homecoming for the Holidays
programme.desc: Country singer Charlotte is home for the holidays and brother Ryan's fellow ex-soldier Matt is in town. Writing her new album, Charlotte works with Matt to build a house for a friend in town.

programme.title: Three Wise Men and a Baby
programme.desc: Three brothers get the surprise of their lives when they are forced to work together and care for a baby over the holidays.

programme.title: Inventing the Christmas Prince
programme.desc: Shelby is about to quit her job as a rocket engineer when her daughter becomes convinced that her Scrooge-like boss, Evan, is the Christmas Prince; a story Shelby invented years ago.

programme.title: My Grown Up Christmas List
programme.desc: Taylor and Luke have a special bond that grows between them after several Christmases spent together and apart.

programme.title: A Glenbrooke Christmas
programme.desc: Longing to be accepted for herself and not just her wealth, an heiress heads to the small town of Glenbrooke, where she discovers the joys of a simple Christmas, community, and maybe even love.

programme.title: All Saints Christmas
programme.desc: Lisette is a popular R&B singer who’s getting ready to travel home to New Orleans for Christmas.

programme.title: Ghosts of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Ellie is told by a fortune teller that she must resolve her past and make amends with all of those she ghosted before Christmas and discovers love in the process.

programme.title: Cranberry Christmas
programme.desc: A separated couple feign marital bliss on national television to help their town's Christmas festival - and their business. But what will be when rekindled love is complicated by new opportunities?

programme.title: mareTV: Sweden's High Coast
programme.desc: Sweden's Höga Kusten (High Coast) has been rising by almost one centimetre per year since the last ice age 10,000 years ago. This has created a hilly Baltic Sea landscape on the Gulf of Bothnia with small and large islands. Untouched nature, dense forests and energetic, rather idiosyncratic islanders have plenty of room there. Every year at the end of August a biting stench mixes with the fresh Baltic Sea breeze. For weeks the so-called sour herring, Swedish: Surströmming, is fermented in brine. Ruben Madsen is a producer of surströmming and an absolute connoisseur. In his wooden hut on the island of Ulvön he puts the herring in according to a traditional recipe. At the start of the season, the cans are opened for the first time. Lovers of the "stinky fish" then come from all over the world to taste the now world-famous delicacy in cans. Opening the cans of "rotten fish" is considered internationally as a test of courage, people film themselves doing so, the inhabitants of the High Coast can only smile about it.

programme.title: mareTV: Denmarks Limfjord - From Sea to Sea
programme.desc: Wide open spaces, water, meadows: The Limfjord stretches through Jutland in Denmark in countless bays, canals and sounds. Mighty water castles, country palaces and magnificent monasteries are enthroned on its shores. It is a rather lonely area, even in high summer it is quiet. This is probably why the people here are so friendly and sociable. Birte, Silla and Bo cycle to their fjord garden project in the harbor of the town of Løgstør to harvest mussels, oysters and seaweed. They think gardening is best in a club. Luckily, Silla, a resourceful tinkerer, has just made another ingenious invention: the mussel washing machine. Cruising the narrow Næssund, a branch of the Limfjord, is the Næssund Ferry, the smallest and oldest car ferry in the area. New on board, and the first and only woman on this ship, is deckhand Lilian Kohler. She is "girl for everything", but wants more, because Lilian is a trained navigator. She is magically drawn to the bridge, but the old captain doesn't think much of retiring ashore.

programme.title: Lunenburg: Where the Land Meets the Sea
programme.desc: On the east coast of Canada, a place whose name sounds strangely familiar. The small town of Lunenburg, west of Halifax, was founded in 1753 by North German immigrants. Today, the idyllic town with its many wooden houses is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. In the 19th century, Lunenburg was one of the richest towns in the British Empire, becoming prosperous through fishing and shipbuilding. Glenn Rhodenizer's family traces back ten generations directly to German immigrants. And what the Rhodenizers primarily grow on their fields directly by the sea could hardly be more typical: it is white cabbage, which the farming family processes into sauerkraut. Sauerkraut can be found in every restaurant and supermarket in this area; it is the specialty of the region. The heritage of wooden boat building is successfully maintained by David Westergard. In his ancient shed, he is assembling a 20-meter schooner from four different types of local wood. Building wooden boats, he says, is like "slow food": sustainable, conscious, environmentally friendly, waste-free.

programme.title: mareTV: The Eckernförde Bay - Beach shooters, mine clearance divers, squirrels
programme.desc: Fjord, ford, bay, gulf: there are many names for the beautiful extensions of the Baltic Sea into the country. Eckernförde Bay is shaped by currents, surf and people. It stretches 17 kilometers to the town that gives it its name. Stephan Möller is the acting shooting master of the Eckernförder Bürgerschützengilde. He spent a whole year preparing the beach shooting festival and then this: fog, rain and a stiff breeze. Traditionally, the Eckernförde marksmen always shoot at a wooden bird in the direction of the sea at Whitsun. Under strict conditions! And these stipulate a clear view of at least one kilometer out into the bay. The event literally threatens to fall through, for the first time in 449 years. Around 3,000 soldiers are stationed at the Eckernförde naval base, but only a small group is allowed to call itself an elite unit: the mine divers. They are considered the toughest soldiers in the Navy. Anyone who wants to be one of them has to undergo extreme training. This year, just two candidates made it to the final round. Now they still have to pass the dreaded final exam: running 20 kilometers with marching gear and then swimming ten kilometers through Eckernförde Bay.

programme.title: mareTV: Wismar Bay - World Heritage and Water Paradise
programme.desc: The Wismar Bay is unique in its diversity on the Mecklenburg Baltic Sea coast: cliffs, sandy beaches, salt marshes, enchanted islands and, last but not least, the proud Hanseatic city of Wismar with its brick Gothic buildings, which are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. When the mighty logs get wedged together in the timber mill in the port of Wismar, Steven Buchholz has to get to work with his chainsaw. It's a dangerous job, because the logs weigh tons. As a trained carpenter, Steven is a virtuoso with the chain saw. Even after his shift is over, he is looking for the thrill: the wind off his home island of Poel is favorable that day and he wants to reclaim the German record in the kite surfing high jump. For a long time, Ramona Stelzer only knew fish as a tasty ingredient between two halves of a bun. But when the goldsmith got her hands on fish leather, her business idea was born: she processes the unique natural product fish skin into fine jewelry. The problem is that hardly anyone in Germany tans fish skin. In order to reliably obtain supplies, Ramona now wants to learn this craft herself.

programme.title: mareTV: Estonia's Enchanted Islands - Kihnu, Hiiumaa, Saaremaa & Co
programme.desc: Kihnu is one of 19 inhabited Estonian islands. When the women there ride motorcycles in colourful skirts, it is summer. Thanks to its remoteness, charming traditions have been preserved here. More than 2,000 islands belong to Estonia, none is like the other, each with its own character. Most of them were military restricted areas during the Soviet Union. Of all things, the strict shielding had its good points: beach, forest, juniper groves, they still characterise the landscape of Estonia's enchanted islands. Elly Karjam is a "multi-jobber": lighthouse keeper, ice-cream producer and contract knitter for the famous Kihnu sweaters. Summer is high season for her: She is expecting guests from the USA, who had their ancestors on Kihnu. Birches have to be cut for the so-called viht. This bunch of birch branches is an important accessory for the traditional sauna at midsummer. And the motorcycles in the shed are to be refloated.

programme.title: Discover Poland
programme.desc: The world‘s best helicopter camera system - the Cineflex Camera - was used for this documentary and delivered fantastic images in HD quality, revealing the surprisingly diverse landscapes and fascinating towns of Poland from a bird‘s eye view of Poland‘s medieval towns, the modern silhouette of Warsaw, the untouched nature of the border regions between east and west, the coasts to the north and the mountain ranges of the south

programme.title: The Provence coast - Marseille and the Côte Bleue
programme.desc: The Provence is famed for its endless fields of laven-der, but this lush landscape also has a beautifully mari-time touch: The Côte Bleue! Small, hidden beaches, charming harbour towns, imposing, craggy bays and a uniquely clear light that has attracted painters includ-ing Cézanne and Braque. The coast derives its name from the deep blue water and extends from Marseille to Martigues. This small town is also known as "The Ven-ice of the North", as it is shaped entirely by water: an inland lake, the sea itself, as well as a connecting canal. In the bays of the Calanques, the steeply-walled coastal inlets in the Mediterranean limestone, Lionel Franc is a cliff diver. His personal record is a hight of 36 metres! Ambi is a sculptress. This young artist's work, who moved to Marseille from Madagascar many years ago, is characterised by a dynamic momentum. As a pas-sionate pétanque player, she demonstrates this drive on the boules courts of the port city. John Pendray is Pein-tre officiel de la Marine, an official marine painter. The French state allows just 40 painters to its circle. There are no monetary rewards, but heaps of honour and a very smart uniform!

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: England: The Pilgrim's Way to Canterbury
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, the horrifying murder of Archbishop Thomas Becket of Canterbury led thousands of pilgrims to the south of England. Centuries later, the long-forgotten Pilgrims' Way is now enjoying a revival. The Pilgrims Way leads east to west cross-country from Winchester to Canterbury through the counties of Hampshire, Surrey and Kent.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: France: The Mont-Saint-Michel Way
programme.desc: In honour of the Archangel Michael, thousands of medieval Christians set off on pilgrimages to the famous mountain monastery of the Mont-Saint-Michel in the Atlantic Ocean. Today it continues to enchant millions of visitors each year. But the pilgrimage route from Rouen to the mountain abbey seems to have been forgotten: it leads through the depths of Normandy into rural France.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: Switzerland, Italy: The VIA FRANCIGENA to Rome
programme.desc: For centuries, pilgrims have set off on the Via Francigena in the hopes of reaching the tombs of the apostles Peter and Paul in Rome. The ancient pilgrimage route leads through the imposing Alps to the Great St Bernard Pass and from there cross-country through Italy.

programme.title: mareTV: Scotland's Mild West - On The Inner Hebrides
programme.desc: The Inner Hebrides surprise with green hills, fine sandy beaches and a mild climate, at least as far as Scottish conditions allow. This is ensured by the currents of the Gulf Stream, as well as the Scottish archipelago being protected by its sister islands, which belong to the Outer Hebrides. More than half of the almost 80 islands are uninhabited. Loneliness has made the people rather inventive. On Tiree Island, mathematics, history and physics from the mainland arrive in the classroom per mouseclick. Dr Mauvis Gore and Prof. Rupert Ormond cast off from the island of Mull, after setting a course to encounter a basking shark. The cetohinus maximus is the world's second largest fish and the two scientists are absolutely convinced that the waters surrounding the Mull constitute the mating grounds for the basking sharks. A logistical challenge takes place on the Isle of Easdale each September. Then, around 400 people populate the tiny slate island. Donals "Mellon" Melville organises the World Skimming Championships, a World Cup in jumping stones. This is all about the distance they are thrown and they must only hop above the water twice.

programme.title: In the Heart of Scotland - By Train trough the Lowlands
programme.desc: The first part of this journey through Scotland begins in the colourful and vibrant capital, Edinburgh. It takes us through the rolling hills of the Scottish Lowlands, en route to the wild, picturesque east coast and Aberdeen. There are new and exciting views behind every bend: heath-covered hills with a magically purple glow, beautiful lakes and forests of the deepest shades of green. The breath-taking camerawork for this documentary received the Columbus Film Award.

programme.title: mareTV: Jersey - Sunshine Island in the English Channel
programme.desc: Jersey: the Channel Island is one of the areas in the UK that can boast the most hours of annual sunshine. Not that Dave Cowburn cares very much. He works in the dark, cool ducts of an old bunker from the Sec-ond World War. Here, he breeds turbot, and is very successful at it, too. The "Jersey Royal", the regal potato, has been grown on the island since 1880, fertilized with seaweed from the surrounding ocean. In the third generation, Christine Hellio manages approximately 20 hectares on the coast. "The potato is our most important export commodity", she says. It is harvested by hand, as machines cannot be used on the steep fields. The price is quite regal, too: One kilogram costs 6 Euros. Hugh Gill is one of around 240 voluntary police officers on Jersey. The Honorary Police is regarded as the oldest organised police system in the world. Hugh works for them for one week every month. On the green lanes, the streets of Jersey, the speed limit is 15 miles per hour. Jersey has an immense tidal range and with up to 13 metres difference, it is the world's third largest. This is good for a rarity: the Ormer - one of the world's most expensive species of snail.

programme.title: mareTV: Sweden's High Coast
programme.desc: Sweden's Höga Kusten (High Coast) has been rising by almost one centimetre per year since the last ice age 10,000 years ago. This has created a hilly Baltic Sea landscape on the Gulf of Bothnia with small and large islands. Untouched nature, dense forests and energetic, rather idiosyncratic islanders have plenty of room there. Every year at the end of August a biting stench mixes with the fresh Baltic Sea breeze. For weeks the so-called sour herring, Swedish: Surströmming, is fermented in brine. Ruben Madsen is a producer of surströmming and an absolute connoisseur. In his wooden hut on the island of Ulvön he puts the herring in according to a traditional recipe. At the start of the season, the cans are opened for the first time. Lovers of the "stinky fish" then come from all over the world to taste the now world-famous delicacy in cans. Opening the cans of "rotten fish" is considered internationally as a test of courage, people film themselves doing so, the inhabitants of the High Coast can only smile about it.

programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Kevin Richardson shares an extraordinary bond with Africa’s most fearsome predators. Together with them, he has experienced some real adventures. However, transporting 27 lions and 14 hyenas to a new home presents a different challenge.The lions' new home will be a sanctuary on the edge of Dinokeng, a South African game reserve spanning 18,000 square metres. The huge task ahead includes planning and designing the new enclosures, and securing permits to move the animals.

programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Not only are the animals regularly rotated into new enclosures to prevent repetitive behaviour developing out of boredom, but Kevin also has to practice loading them in and out of the van. Can the reluctant lions and hyenas eventually be persuaded to get on board with the move?

programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Orphanage of Elephants - Nairobi Nationalpark
programme.desc: We follow the rescue of a baby elephant. Once rescued, it will be transported by plane to the breeding station and raised with love and commitment. In order to satisfy the little pachyderm’s urge to move while in the breeding station, there is sometimes an adorable football match between the animals.

programme.title: Elephants: Back to the Wild
programme.sub-title: Elephants: Back to the Wild: The Return of the Elephants - Tsavo-East-Nationalpark
programme.desc: We accompany the first steps of a two-year-old elephant who is just starting his release program. We also observe the story of two young elephants in their first night in the wilderness on their own. Captivating film footage allows us to truly learn how elephants behave in the wild.

programme.title: Namibia`s Desert Kingdom
programme.desc: Although the dunes are barren, the dry riverbeds show signs of growth. And out of the heat, vast shapes appear. A herd of desert elephants ambles along the dry riverbed sniffing the ground with their lazy trunks. These remarkable creatures can smell the water underground and know where to find it. An abandoned well attracts a troop of chacma baboons, followed by a small herd of oryx and springbok, and finally a group of jackals. None of them has seen the pride of desert lions lying in wait.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Morocco
programme.desc: Once a year the royal city of Meknes is transformed into an oriental camp. Two thousand curious onlookers gather round the square. More than five hundred riders are expected to take part in this major Fantasia, a warlike display of horsemanship. 56-year old Lachsen Slimani is also obsessed with riding games. He lives with his family on a remote highland plateau in the Middle Atlas. Lachsen is proud because his 18-year old son Mohammed wants to follow in his father’s footsteps. For that he needs his own horse, so the tradition goes. Lachsen wants to fulfil this dream for his son. So, in order to get the money together for the horse, he takes off on an adventure and is travelling to Quarzazate, which is also called the Hollywood of the desert.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Iceland
programme.desc: Iceland, the island of longing in the North. The biggest volcanic island in the world is known for its grandiose landscape, for its geysers and glaciers. But it is even more famous for its horses. Icelandic horses are considered the liveliest horses in the whole of Europe with the greatest stamina. They tölt over mossy banks and lava rock unfazed by rivers, glaciers and scree slopes. In Nordic mythology the steed are never far behind the warriors. Where would Siefgried be without his horse Grani, or Odin without Sleipnir. Even the sun wouldn’t rise or set if “awake early” and “very quick” weren’t pulling their chariot. From the beginning of colonisation, the Icelanders had the kind of close relationship with their horses usually only seen among the horse-riding peoples of Central Asia. And something of this love for horses still exists today. Life without horses would be unthinkable for Haukur Goroarsson, too. The 34-year old lives with his family in Vatnsdalur, a fertile valley in the North four hours by car from the capital city, Reykjavik. For him Icelandic horses are “a sort of Viking on four legs”. The settlement of this inhospitable island on the Arctic Circle would not have been possible without the animals. The stone deserts in the country’s interior are too vast to be crossed on foot.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - India
programme.desc: Proud elegance, silky-shiny coats and a graceful, powerful physique – the supreme Marwari horses have been worshipped in India as magical creatures for thousands of years. People say they descended directly from the Gods, that once when the Gods were sitting round the fire, there was so much soot that one of the Gods had to cry. One of the tears from his right eye changed into a stallion, and one of his tears from the left eye produced a mare. Ever since, the people in Rajasthan have believed that horses are Gods. Maharaja – palaces, temples and citadels, women in colourful saris and men with bright turbans – the land of the Rajas, the king’s sons, arouse fantasies reminiscent of One Thousand and One Nights. Lively trading and war-related incidents from the past have led to the emergence of a unique horse culture in the region: Marwaris are the proud horses of the Indian Rajas. Each year in November, the small, barren desert oasis of Pushkar is transformed into a place of pilgrimage for millions of Indians. Everybody who is anybody on the horse scene in Rajasthan - Maharajas, breeders and horse masters - meets at the Pushkar Mela, the turbulent market for over 50,000 horses and camels. Pushkar is the place where the legendary Marwaris are bought and sold.

programme.title: Dust And Stripes
programme.desc: In a never-ending quest for grass and water, the striped herds undertake an annual epic trek across the vast lunar landscape of the Kalahari’s Makgadikgadi Pans. Most of the year, the Makgadikgadi is an inhospitable wasteland of windswept, salt-encrusted pans. For the area’s water-dependent zebra, the Boteti River on the western edge of the pans is a dry-season lifeline. However, it is also a death trap, with lions waiting in ambush and crocodiles lurking in dark riverside caves.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Fish
programme.desc: They are virtually unchanged from their ancestors, who swam in ancient rivers when the dinosaurs still ruled the planet. Their unfertilised eggs became black gold, served in only the most expensive restaurants as caviar. This ancient giant is the Beluga Sturgeon, considered by some to be the largest freshwater fish in the world. Sturgeons are now at the very edge of extinction because of the exclusive market for their eggs, but only the eggs can allow the species to live. Paradoxically, the desire for caviar may now be the only chance they have for their future existence.

programme.title: Jacques Cousteau's Legacy - Return To The Undersea World
programme.desc: A composition of wildlife footage, archive material and elaborate re-enactments results in a brilliant reconstruction of the life of famed marine biologist and environmental pioneer Jacques Cousteau. On the trail of the most famous oceanographer of the 20th Century, the team spent two years filming original locations on three different continents, in four different oceans. The film charts how Cousteau’s outlook on the environment changed throughout his many decades at sea around the globe. On his personal journey to enlightenment, he changed from a man who killed sharks in hate and thoughtlessly blew up coral reefs, to a radical environmentalist.

programme.title: Follow Your Cat
programme.desc: Follow us while we follow cats on their hunting grounds for mice and birds. Experience the double life of your domestic tiger... she will lead you on adventures that you never thought were possible. With a behavioural scientist that specializes in cats and modern technology we follow the cat on their wanderings into the wild. She maps their routes, unveils their secret favourite places, chronicles their territorial conquests, and shows us the entertaining habits of this enigmatic creature.

programme.title: Animal River Challenge
programme.desc: Rainer Bergomaz searches for the Eagle in the canopy of Guyana's unspoiled rainforest.
